data.title: Employment Opportunities
data.text:
Equal Opportunity Employer

The Los Angeles Community College District is an equal opportunity educator and employer. The policy of the LACCD is to provide an educational, employment, and business environment free from prohibited discrimination in violation of state or federal law on the basis of actual or perceived ethnic group identification, race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, creed, sex (including gender-based sexual harassment), pregnancy, marital status, cancer-related medical condition of an employee, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, or veteran status.

It is the policy of the Los Angeles Community College District to maintain a drug-free workplace.

Why Work at LACCD?

As the largest community college district in California and among the largest in the nation, we are an employer of choice. We offer our employees the opportunity to pursue a stimulating and worthwhile career in a friendly and diverse environment that nurtures talent and rewards success.

With nine colleges throughout the greater Los Angeles Area, you can work close to home and family. Learn more about our colleges and where they are located.

From health plans to educational assistance programs, from retirement savings to time off, the well-being of our employees and their families is our top priority.

For more information about our mission, values, and much more, visit the About Us page.

Links to Current Opportunities

Don't wait. Apply today!

We invite you to view our current vacancies and find all of the information you need about working with our team of talented and committed administrators, faculty, and staff. If you are not able to identify a suitable opportunity at the moment, please visit our website regularly.

Academic Jobs

Current job openings and application information for full-time and part-time faculty, counselors, librarians, various learning specialists, and academic administrator positions.

Classified Jobs

Current job openings and application information for clerical-technical, maintenance and operations, building trades, and non-academic supervisor, professional, and management positions.

Project MATCH is an instructional internship program for people who want to teach, be a librarian or counselor and is designed to promote quality instruction and diversity in community college teaching

Information regarding student employment opportunities is available through the Personnel Office at each individual college.

For Community College jobs throughout the State, visit the California Community Colleges Registry at: www.cccregistry.org
